name: Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich
description: Spicy chicken sandwiches are trending! Fast food joints everywhere seem to be adding them to their menu. We’ve got you covered with a healthier version to make at home. The coating mix is crispy, gluten-free, and packs a spicy punch, with a hint of sweetness. These sammies have more protein, less sodium, and less fat than take-out. Top them with sliced pickles for the ultimate crunch and tang.
preparation: Preheat oven to 400˚ F. Line Sheet Pan with Sheet Pan Liner.
In a large bowl, beat egg. Add chicken; toss to coat.
Place seasoning in a shallow dish. Add chicken strips, one at a time, using tongs, toss to evenly coat. Place chicken strips on pan.
In a small bowl, add oil. With a basting brush, lightly dab oil onto coated chicken strips. Bake 18–20 min, or until cooked through.
Split and toast buns. To assemble sandwiches, spread buns with 1 tbsp mayo per sandwich. Divide chicken strips between buns. Top with sliced pickles, if desired.
tips: Swap mayo with Chipotle or Roasted Garlic Aioli.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup sliced veggies, your choice.
